;基辅总统弗拉基米尔·泽伦斯基声称，基辅敦促乌克兰人不要恐慌或储存碘片俄罗斯计划在一座被占领的核电站组织辐射泄漏。

;

;泽伦斯基本周表示，控制欧洲最大核电站扎波罗热的俄罗斯军队正在策划通过策划辐射泄漏来发动“恐怖袭击”。

;

; p>;

;克里姆林宫称这是一个“谎言”，但总统的警告让许多乌克兰人保持警惕，许多药店对碘的需求猛增。

;

;“阅读并分享，但不要惊慌！不要玩敌人的游戏。泽伦斯基总统没有说什么新内容。乌克兰卫生部表示，俄罗斯是一个恐怖主义国家，就像拿着手榴弹的猴子一样，你可以期待任何事情。

;

;乌克兰称俄罗斯正在密谋对核电站进行挑衅，但没有提供任何证据

;

;在周五的另一份声明中，卫生部警告不要错误地服用碘带来的不利影响，并补充说，这甚至可能致命。

;

;内政部长伊戈尔·克利缅科表示，当局正在监测情况。他在社交媒体上表示：“专家们已经为各种情况做好了准备。”

;

;扎波罗热核电站发生的事故可能会将放射性碘释放到大气中，从而增加患甲状腺癌的风险，就像在核电站事故发生后发生的那样。 1986 年切尔诺贝利灾难。

;

;这些药片可以帮助防止放射性碘在甲状腺中浓缩，从而可以自然地将其排出体外。

;

;基辅没有出现恐慌性抢购的迹象周五，药剂师们纷纷前来，但对碘片的需求却猛增。

;

;21 岁的药房员工玛丽亚·杜勒 (Maria Duler) 表示：“没有恐慌，但每个人都很谨慎。”

;

; 37 岁的基辅居民基里尔·扎鲁宁 (Kirill Zalunin) 表示，他看到了卫生部的建议，但没有跑去购买碘。

;

;“如果你对所有这些言论做出反应，你可能会失去理智， ”他说。

;

;首都另一位居民奥克萨娜·扎夫戈罗德尼亚 (Oksana Zavgorodnia) 表示，她并不害怕。

;

;“我们厌倦了害怕。我们希望一切顺利。”52 岁的她和丈夫离开一家药店时说道。

;

;在莫斯科入侵期间，人们对核电站的担忧一直存在，而且自核电站被摧毁以来，这种担忧加剧了。联合国核事务负责人拉斐尔·格罗西周五在俄罗斯欧洲飞地加里宁格勒会见了俄罗斯原子能机构负责人，但讨论并未宣布取得突破。

;作为对抗中国日益增长的影响力的印太战略的一部分，美国总统乔拜登定期邀请具有重要战略意义的地区的不同政治色彩的领导人来到白宫。

;

;本周，拜登为印度总理纳伦德拉·莫迪举办了国宴。莫迪是一位公开的印度教民族主义领导人，曾被美国拒绝入境。与此形成鲜明对比的是，莫迪在南亚的盟友之一却引起了华盛顿的坚决反对：孟加拉国总理谢赫·哈西娜。

;

;当该国任职时间最长的总理哈西娜于 5 月访问美国首都，参加世界银行的活动，但拜登政府中没有人选择会见她。

;

;尽管是南亚地区的重要参与者，也是南亚地区的重要参与者之一。作为增长最快的经济体，孟加拉国遭到了华盛顿的冷落和有关人权和民主的简短演讲。

;

;2021 年 12 月，拜登结束了美国主导的首届民主峰会 — — 孟加拉国参加了此次峰会未受邀请 - 财政部制裁了孟加拉国精锐准军事部队的七名领导人，他们被指控代表哈西娜政府对政治对手进行强迫失踪和法外处决。

;

;此举是在德里克·乔莱 (Derek Chollet) 二月份发出警告之后采取的美国国务院参赞表示，孟加拉国民主的侵蚀将限制华盛顿与达卡合作的能力。他敦促哈西娜确保自由和公正的选举。

;

;到了四月份，双边关系急剧恶化，哈西娜指责华盛顿“试图消除孟加拉国的民主”。

;

;被一些人称为“ 75 岁的哈西娜因其日益独裁的治理风格而成为亚洲“铁娘子”，她拒绝了一些批评人士要求她退休的呼吁。

;

;“因为如果我不在那里……我不知道谁会是这样的人。”她在美国访问期间说道，当时她的反对者和支持者在她位于弗吉尼亚州的酒店外发生冲突。

;

;白宫表示邀请莫迪“并不是要向中国传递信息”

;

;几周后，哈西娜再次经受住了拜登政府的冷落：美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯公布了一项政策，威胁要拒绝向任何试图阻碍孟加拉国自由公正民主选举的人发放美国签证。

;

;作为回应，达卡表示“希望在更广泛的背景下看待这一宣布，即政府明确承诺在各级举行自由和公平的选举”。

;

;分析人士将华盛顿的立场描述为对哈西娜条件的断言的驳斥。孟加拉国的民众赞成此类选举。​​

;

;虽然没有公开针对政府，但该政策表明“明确拒绝”哈西娜的主张，即“该国普遍存在有利于自由和公平选举的环境”总部位于华盛顿的智库大西洋理事会的阿里·里亚兹 (Ali Riaz) 表示。

;

;该政策的广泛范围反映了“华盛顿对孟加拉国治理日益不满”，里亚兹补充道。

;

;但华盛顿另一家智库威尔逊中心的迈克尔·库格曼表示，拜登的“基于价值观”的外交正在被选择性地运用。

;

;“拜登政府已将孟加拉国作为其基于价值观的外交政策的一个例子强调在海外促进人权和民主。”他在《外交政策》杂志上写道。

;

;自 2014 年以来，华盛顿很少公开谈论莫迪统治下新德里的“民主倒退”，但对达卡的关注却是最多的。库格曼补充道，所支付的费用“稳健且一致”。

;

;莫迪的红地毯待遇表明，美国总统的人权议程在大国竞争中“退居二线”，马修·杜斯 (Matthew Duss) 表示华盛顿智库卡内基国际和平基金会。

;

;“政府的做法似乎是，只有在所有战略激励措施正确排列且不会造成国内政治动荡的情况下，美国才会对侵权行为施加后果。”杜斯在最近的一篇专栏文章中写道。

;

;哈西娜强硬、不屈服的方式或许是环境塑造的。哈西娜于 1947 年印度从英国独立后出生于新成立的巴基斯坦，1975 年军事政变后，她的父亲谢赫·穆吉布尔·拉赫曼 (Sheikh Mujibur Ra​​hman) 与其他家庭成员一起被暗杀，哈西娜被迫流亡。

;

;人民联盟政党领导人穆吉布尔·拉赫曼 (Mujibur Ra​​hman) 于 1971 年在印度的帮助下领导建立了独立的孟加拉国（以前称为东巴基斯坦）。

;

;“新穷人”：气候变化、新冠肺炎、通货膨胀加剧了不平等在孟加拉国

;

;1981 年返回孟加拉国后，哈西娜发现自己进出拘留中心并被软禁多年。她组织反对该国当时的军政府，最终于 1996 年成为总理并任职至 2001 年。她于 2009 年再次赢得最高职位，此后一直掌权。

;

;在哈西娜的领导下，这个国家数据提供商 CEIC 的数据显示，1.7 亿人已经实现了经济转型，在冠状病毒大流行之前的十年里，年平均增长率为 7%。

;

;世界银行将孟加拉国描述为“一个非凡的故事”根据每天 2.15 美元的国际贫困线，贫困率从 1991 年的 41.9% 下降到 2016 年的 13.5%。

;

;几十年来，该国一直是世界上贫困率最低的国家之一。按照联合国的定义，孟加拉国预计到 2026 年将成为发展中国家。

;

;然而，去年，哈西娜政府在经济衰退后向国际货币基金组织寻求援助，以提振孟加拉国经济外汇储备、乌克兰战争造成的经济混乱以及气候变化带来的宏观经济风险。 1 月份，国际货币基金组织同意提供 47 亿美元贷款。

;

;根据透明国际 2022 年腐败感知指数，孟加拉国还被列为南亚最腐败的国家，仅次于阿富汗。哈西娜通过大规模逮捕和警察突袭来镇压反对派和独立媒体。

;

;与此同时，她在中美印太地区竞争阴影下的外交政策也引发了密切关注。< /p>;

;位于孟加拉湾战略位置的孟加拉国一直避免在大国斗争中选边站队。它位于印度洋和太平洋之间连接南亚与东亚和中东的商业贸易的重要过境区。

;

;4 月，达卡发布了第一份关于印太的官方政策，呼吁建立“基于规则的多边体系”以促进“公平和可持续发展”。它没有表现出对美国或中国的明确偏好。

;

;这种平衡的尝试导致了达卡与拜登政府的关系恶化。但两国关系并不总是冷淡。

;

;美国是 1971 年最早承认孟加拉国为独立国家的国家之一，华盛顿是达卡最大的贸易伙伴之一。两国还协调反恐努力，包括在孟加拉湾举行联合军事演习。

;

;2020 年，时任美国副国务卿史蒂芬·比根 (Stephen Biegun) 称孟加拉国为印太地区的“重要伙伴”， “这是我们在该地区工作的核心”，并补充说美国致力于发展“伙伴关系”。

;

;批评者称，美国的地区战略与中国相比简直是天壤之别

;

;他邀请孟加拉国参加印太商业论坛，该论坛旨在促进美国与印太国家之间的贸易、投资和经济合作。

;

;有人认为比根的言论是美国的邀请孟加拉国加入四边安全对话，该组织包括印度、日本和澳大利亚，北京认为该组织的战略目标是反华的。

;

;2021 年，有报道称孟加拉国正在考虑加入在四方会谈中，北京警告达卡如果这样做将“严重”损害两国关系。与邻国印度不同，孟加拉国并未寻求加入四方机制。

;

;以色列国家安全委员会前亚太区主任约瑟夫·罗森 (Joseph Rozen) 将美国与孟加拉国最近的紧张局势描述为中国扩大其影响力的“机会”。

;

;“中国提供资金时不会对孟加拉国的民主倒退大惊小怪，”他说。

;

;在拒绝承认孟加拉国为独立国家并在此事上与巴基斯坦站在一起之后1975年，中国与达卡建交。两国关系稳步改善，并于2002年签署了涵盖军事训练和联合武器生产的防务协议。

;

;到2016年，达卡加入了中国主导的贸易计划在习近平主席访问首都期间，该倡议现在被称为“一带一路”倡议。

;

;此后有报道称孟加拉国正在考虑加入“全球发展倡议”。北京声称，习近平于 2021 年发起的这一倡议旨在促进减贫、粮食安全和其他有利于发展中经济体的领域的国际合作。

;

;据孟加拉国统计局称，中国是孟加拉国最大的贸易伙伴统计局及其最大的外国直接投资者和军事供应商，包括飞机、加油机、战斗机和潜艇。

;

;在过去六个月中，北京高级官员访问了达卡，其中包括令人惊讶的午夜停留中国外交部长秦刚在美国助理国务卿唐纳德·卢一月份访华前夕发表讲话。中国外交部副部长孙卫东于 5 月访问了达卡。

;

;拜登在担任总统期间基本上忽视了哈西娜，预计他将在 9 月份在纽交所举行的 G20 峰会上与这位孟加拉国领导人面对面。德里。

;

;孟加拉国已受邀作为印度嘉宾出席。与拜登一样，莫迪与哈西娜有着亲切的个人关系。

;

;孟加拉国准备迎接更多骚乱，因为总理哈西娜拒绝下台的呼吁

;

;印度记者纳亚尼玛·巴苏 (Nayanima Basu) 在最近的一次采访中表示：编辑称，是莫迪说服唐纳德·特朗普政府“承认并接受”孟加拉国2018年的选举结果。

;

;莫迪当时向美国保证，哈西娜政府将保持稳定，并致力于美国的战略和经济利益巴苏表示，达卡将“阻止中国并继续玩微妙的平衡游戏”。

;

;然而，最近新德里在民主党领导下“安抚美国的担忧”并不容易。巴苏补充道，党对白宫和参议院的控制，并指出党的领导层“一直质疑哈西娜的人权记录和她的治理方式”。

;

;在美国之行期间，这位孟加拉国领导人坚持认为不干涉华盛顿和北京所关心的事情。

;

;“美国和中国之间的关系是他们自己的事，”哈西娜说。 “我为什么要把鼻子戳那里？”

;武器主管因枪杀一名电影摄影师而被控过失杀人罪亚历克·鲍德温 (Alec Baldwin) 电影《鲁斯特》(Rust) 的墨西哥片场周四因涉嫌在枪击当天将毒品传递给他人而被指控篡改证据。

;

;汉娜·古铁雷斯-里德 (Hannah Gutierrez-Reed) “确实故意将毒品传递给另一个人”防止自己被逮捕、起诉或定罪”，该案任命的特别检察官在圣达菲县法院文件中表示。他们没有提供更多细节。

;

;在《Rust》枪击案中第一次被定罪，因为片场经理接受了认罪协议

;

;古铁雷斯-里德的律师杰森·鲍尔斯称此举是“报复性和报复性的”。

;

;“令人震惊的是，经过 20 个月的调查，特别检察官现在对 Gutierrez Reed 女士提出全新的指控，没有事先通知或任何证人陈述、实验室报告或证据支持。 ，”鲍尔斯在一份声明中说。

;

;检察官于 4 月份撤销了对鲍德温的非自愿过失杀人指控，古铁雷斯-里德是此案中唯一剩下的被告，鲍德温在排练期间用枪指着电影摄影师哈利娜·哈钦斯。 2021 年 10 月 21 日，爆炸导致她死亡，导演乔尔·苏扎 (Joel Souza) 受伤。检察官仍然可以重新对鲍德温提出指控。

;

; Fri, 23 Jun 2023 22:20:02 +0800 In Argentina, US dollars are so scarce that yuan use is at record highhttps://www.scmp.com/news/asia/article/3225220/argentina-us-dollars-are-so-scarce-yuan-use-record-high?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.23 21:33;
;;

;It has gotten so hard to find US dollars in Argentina that Whirlpool, the American appliance giant, is considering paying with China's yuan to import parts for a new factory.

;

;It is not alone.

;

;Across the South American country, a dwindling US dollar supply is leading companies to embrace a currency that otherwise has played a peripheral role in international trade. The trend highlights both Argentina's dire financial straits and China's ambitions for the yuan.

;

;“The central bank doesn't have dollars so it needs the emergency aid China is offering,” said Marcelo Elizondo, a trade economist in Buenos Aires. “For Argentina, its currency ties to China represents an emergency, but for China it's a point of leverage to take advantage of a geopolitical opportunity.”

;

;The dollar's supremacy in global trade is being chipped away by fragmentation, particularly in developing countries, caused by the US-China rivalry. Russia's economic isolation following its invasion of Ukraine has also opened up non-dollar trade routes to avoid sanctions.

;

;Neighbouring Brazil, for instance, intends to use more yuan, too, a political decision by President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva to seek alternatives to the dollar.

;

;In Argentina, however, the yuan represents a quick, short-term solution to keep assembly lines moving as long-term planning is challenged by surging inflation and zigzagging policy.

;

;China recently allowed Argentina to use more than half of a US$18 billion currency swap line to support trade between them. The two nations have shared a bilateral swap agreement since 2009, which was conceived as a sort of an insurance policy to strengthen foreign reserves during liquidity crises.

;

;“The only option it has left is to access the yuan from the China swap line,” said Maria Castiglioni, director of consulting firm C&T Asesores in Buenos Aires.

;

;More than 500 Argentine companies have requested to pay for imports in yuan, including electronics, auto parts and textile makers, as well as oil and mining firms, according to the country's customs agency.

;

;Officials have also authorised import payments in the Chinese currency equivalent to US$2.9 billion, according to the central bank. In first 10 days of June, yuan transactions in Argentina's currency market totalled about US$285 million, double for all of May.

;

;As well, the share of yuan transactions in Argentina's foreign currency market recently hit a daily record of 28 per cent, compared with as high as 5 per cent last month, according to data from Mercado Abierto Electrónico, one of the country's biggest exchanges.

;

;Whirlpool, the Michigan-based home appliance-maker, is among companies in Argentina now looking at using the yuan instead of dollars. The company invested US$52 million in its factory outside Buenos Aires last year to make washing machines and other products.

;

;Now struggling for imports amid the dollar squeeze and after shortages paused production briefly in recent months, the company is considering paying for some inputs in yuan to ensure a steady supply of key electronic parts.

;

;“We've had to stop the factory at some points and that's not good for business, productivity nor quality,” Juan Carlos Puente, president of Whirlpool Latin America, said, adding that the company plans to export about 70 per cent of its production in Argentina.

;

;“We're working to see how we can leverage this new avenue of flows to be able to continue importing materials,” he said, acknowledging that changing currencies “isn't easy”.

;

;If it moves ahead with the plan, Whirlpool would join the ranks of Argentine companies like Mirgor and Newsan, which paid for imports worth US$630 million between May to August using yuan, according to Argentina's customs agency. Other companies are lining up for yuan as the central bank forces firms to find their own dollar financing abroad before waiting months to tap the local foreign exchange market.

;

;Argentina's currency has lost half its value over the past 12 months, the worst performance in emerging markets over that period. The central bank's dollar reserves are at their lowest level since 2016, and when stripping out the swap line, gold and multilateral financing, its liquid cash reserves are actually in negative territory.

;

;As a sign of pressure on the peso, the government on Wednesday reported that its trade deficit in May reached US$1.2 billion, its largest figure in the red since 2018 when a currency crisis erupted.

;

;China has been promoting the yuan as an alternative to the dollar among other steps to broaden its role in the global financial system, including the gradual opening up of Chinese financial markets and authorities' exit from regular currency intervention.

;

;The People's Bank of China has signed currency swap agreements with some 40 countries over the years, and steadily expanded its fledgling home-grown network of cross-border yuan payments system, known as the CIPS.

;

;Argentina's rush to pay the bills in yuan comes as government officials negotiate with the International Monetary Fund for more upfront cash from the country's US$44 billion aid programme. Argentina is not complying with any of the key IMF targets after a record drought destroyed an estimated US$20 billion worth of crop exports, exacerbating the dollar shortage.

;US President Joe Biden's comments earlier this week that an alleged “spy balloon” from China strayed into US airspace without the prior knowledge of Chinese President Xi Jinping may be an attempt to play down China's threat, and to assure domestic audiences as Washington re-engages with Beijing, experts said.

;

;Biden's remarks on Tuesday during a fundraising event in California, in which he compared Xi to a “dictator”, were the first from the White House to suggest that the Chinese balloon was off course and not part of a deliberate espionage plot.

;

;The incident in February, in which China had claimed a weather balloon accidentally went astray due to forces out of its control, prompted US Secretary of State Antony Blinken to delay a planned trip to Beijing.

;

;“Don't worry about China.我的意思是，担心中国，但不要担心中国，”拜登在加州的一次筹款活动中说道，引起了一些笑声。 “不，但我是认真的。 China has real economic difficulties.”

;

;Without elaborating on his views about China's economy, Biden then said Xi did not know about the suspected spy balloon that flew over the US in February.

;

;“The reason why Xi Jinping got very upset in terms of when I shot that balloon down with two boxcars full of spy equipment in it, is he didn't know it was there,” Biden said. “No, I'm serious.

;

;“That's what's a great embarrassment for dictators, when they didn't know what happened.那不应该去原来的地方。它被吹离航线，向上穿过阿拉斯加，然后向下穿过美国。 And he didn't know about it.”

;

;Biden's remarks came four months after the incident, during which his senior aides publicly commented about the balloon's capacity to collect key military intelligence from the US.

;

;Blinken, who wrapped up a trip to China earlier this week aimed at resuming dialogue with Beijing, said that the balloon chapter “should be closed”.

;

;Experts said they believed Biden's comments on the balloon and China's economy were a bid to play down the perception of a Chinese threat for domestic audiences and to project US strength.

;

;“I think it was meant to reassure a domestic audience that may be under the impression that Washington is giving away too much by going forward with this visit and by re-engaging in dialogue,” said Amanda Hsiao, senior China analyst for the International Crisis Group think tank.

;

;The route to better US-China ties is a 'two-way street': American diplomat

;

;“It was very much meant to say 'we've got this under control and we came in, in a position of strength',” she said.

;

;But that did not necessarily contradict the framing by the US that China was a pacing challenge, or a competitor wishing to change the international order, she said.

;

;Shen Dingli, a Shanghai-based international relations scholar, said Biden's re-election strategy was to portray the US as stronger than China, as some Americans doubted the country's strength.

;

;“The message was that the US got stronger under his administration while China – under his leadership – got weaker competing with the US.

;

;“Just after he had just sent a secretary of state to China to build guard rails, he collapsed them himself.”

;

;After Biden's “dictator” comment – made just a day after Blinken's diplomacy trip – China's top envoy protested to senior officials at the White House.

;;2023.06.23 20:30;
;;

;Israeli start-up Verobotics plans to deploy dozens of its autonomous robots to inspect and clean the exterior of Hong Kong skyscrapers in the coming months, as the city's developers step up adoption of innovative property technology solutions.

;

;The Tel Aviv-based company's lightweight robots, which are powered by artificial intelligence (AI) technology, can work around the clock and clean buildings up to 10 times faster than traditional workers, which make them a perfect match for the city's around 9,000 high-rise buildings, according to company co-founder and chief executive Ido Genosar.

;

;“By the end of next year, we expect to have more than 50 robots deployed, and by 2025 we will at least double that number”, Genosar told the South China Morning Post in an interview on Wednesday. He said the firm already plans to open a Hong Kong office by the end of this year.

;

;In a positive sign for Verobotics' local prospects, Hong Kong Chief Executive John Lee Ka-chiu acknowledged the potential of its business in the city during a local reception for the 75th Independence Day of the State of Israel last Tuesday.

;

;“As we all know, Hong Kong is world-famous for having a concrete jungle full of high-rise buildings,” Lee said in his speech at the event. “So the business potential for this very innovative robotics project from Israel sounds pretty promising to us all!”

;

;Verobotics' nine-kilogram cleaning robots, which walk on building surfaces using two robotic legs, suction cups and a safety wire, reflect the potential of proptech to modernise certain segments of the city's property sector.

;

;Hong Kong developers are increasingly paying attention to proptech, as its adoption promises to enhance customer experience, reduce pollution, save energy and boost safety in the industry.

;

;“Due to the density of buildings that could benefit from our solution in Hong Kong, it makes sense for us to invest here, and the goal is to grow in the city and use it as a door, or in our case, a window to Asia”, Verobotics' Genosar said.

;

;Founded in 2021, Verobotics first announced its move to Hong Kong in January, when it signed a US$5.4 million deal with local robotics solutions company Robocore Technology, its operational partner and distributor in the city.

;

;Genosar said he initially conceived of the idea for Verobotics when he worked in the facade construction industry in Israel. This sector, he said, widely used so-called building management units (BMUs), large cranes installed on top of buildings to support a platform for workers who clean and do maintenance work on the facade of buildings.

;

;“I couldn't understand why the methods [in the industry] hadn't changed in 100 years,” Genosar said. He asserted that the system of using BMUs was too labour- and time-intensive for building operators and dangerous for workers.

;

;Teaming up with company co-founder and chief technology officer Itay Levitan, Verobonics replaced the BMU with an autonomous system that consists of a roof unit, a climbing robot and a cleaning device, according to Genosar. Their system can purportedly be deployed on a site in less than an hour, with up to six robots cleaning a building's facade at a time.

;

;While there are other existing window-cleaning robot solutions, few of these have replaced the BMU entirely, Genosar said.

;

;The cleaning apparatus is rappelled from under Verobotics' AI-powered robot using a dry brush, rather than traditional liquids and chemicals used for such work. While scaling the side of a building, the robot uses on-board cameras to scan the surface and create a 3D model which can be used to identify structural issues or pinpoint areas of heat or cooling loss, according to Genosar.

;

;Before Hong Kong leader Lee's recent endorsement, Verobotics had already received backing from Sino Group, one of the city's largest property developers.

;

;Verobotics had been part of Sino Group and Hongkong Land's PropXTech accelerator programme. The start-up was selected as part of a group of 10 proptech finalists from around the world that showcased their products in front of Hong Kong industry professionals and investors.

;

;How proptech is changing Hong Kong's property industry

;

;Sino Group has already tested Verobotics' robots on four of its buildings and it will be the first Hong Kong property developer to commercially deploy the company's robots in the city, according to Genosar.

;

;While the current model of Verobotics' cleaning robot is fit for use on certain buildings with glass-and-aluminium facades, Genosar said the company and its local partner have identified hundreds of buildings which could use their solution. He indicated that the firm plans to create new devices for other types of buildings.

;

;Verobotics and partner Robocore expect to first pass safety clearance and obtain permits from several Hong Kong authorities before they can launch their AI-powered robot cleaners locally. Genosar said his company, which has received the necessary permit to operate in Israel, is confident that the robot's built-in safety precautions will prove less hazardous than alternative building cleaning methods.

;

;Hong Kong is no stranger to the potential dangers of window cleaning and building maintenance. Last month, a 38-year-old domestic worker fell to her death while cleaning windows at her employer's flat in Cheung Sha Wan.

;

;On commercial maintenance and construction projects, there have been a number of reported accidents involving human-operated cranes. Last September, a 65-tonne tower crane collapsed at a construction site, killing three workers and injuring six others at a public housing construction site.
